alert.note: Alert for Angelina; Nacogdoches; San Augustine (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 05 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN NACOGDOCHES... ANGELINA AND SAN AUGUSTINE COUNTIES THROUGH 400 AM CDT... At 314 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Woden to near Huntington to Diboll. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Lufkin, Nacogdoches, Diboll, Huntington, San Augustine, Melrose, Woden, Macune, Etoile, Bland Lake, Burke, Zavalla, Chireno, Broaddus, Denning, Shawnee, Homer, Dolan, and Chinaquapin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
